title: it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Act 2005 (as amended), with the
heading: 1. (1) This bye-law may be cited as the Physiotherapists Registration Board
text_raw:
1. (1) This bye-law may be cited as the Physiotherapists Registration Board 
Conditions for Registration in the Referral for Radiological Diagnostic 
Procedures Division Bye-Law 2025. 

(2) This bye-law comes into operation on 7 January 2025.
text_norm: 1 (1) bye-law may cited physiotherapist registration board condition registration referral radiological diagnostic procedure division bye-law 2025 (2) bye-law come operation 7 january 2025

title: it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Act 2005 (as amended), with the
heading: 3. For the purposes of sections 31, 37, and 38 of the Act, the Board has
text_raw:
3. For the purposes of sections 31, 37, and 38 of the Act, the Board has 
determined that where a person wishes to have his or her name entered in the 
Referral for Radiological Diagnostic Procedures Division of the Register, the 
conditions set out in this bye-law must be satisfied and that person must provide 
satisfactory evidence of his or her compliance with this bye-law in his or her 
application for registration.
text_norm: 3 purpose section 31 37 38 act board determined person wish name entered referral radiological diagnostic procedure division register condition set bye-law must satisfied person must provide satisfactory evidence compliance bye-law application registration

title: it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Act 2005 (as amended), with the
heading: In order to be eligible for registration in the Referral for Radiological
text_raw:
4. 

In order to be eligible for registration in the Referral for Radiological 

Diagnostic Procedure Division an applicant must: 

(1) provide proof of registration in the General Division of the Register; or 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 17th January, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [3] 3 

(2) demonstrate that he or she meets the requirements for registration in the 

General Division of the Register; and 

(3) provide evidence of a qualification approved for the purposes of section 
38(2)(a) as attesting to the standard of proficiency required for registration; or 

(4) provide such evidence as may be required by the Board from time to time 
of a professional qualification in referral for radiological diagnostic procedures 
that, in the opinion of the Board, attests to the applicant’s having achieved a 
standard of proficiency corresponding to the standards set by the Board for entry 
into the Referral for Radiological Diagnostic Procedures Division of the 
Register. 

GIVEN under the seal of the Physiotherapists Registration Board, 

7 January, 2025. 

RÓISÍN O HANLON, 

Chairperson, Physiotherapists Registration Board . 

JOHN BIGGINS, 

Member, Physiotherapists Registration Board. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [3]

title: it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Act 2005 (as amended), with the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This bye-law sets out the criteria for entry to Referral for Radiological 
Diagnostic Procedures Division of the Register of Physiotherapists established 
by the Physiotherapists Registration Board. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [3] 5
